metadata.title: CVE-2019-19965 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel through 5.4.6, there is a NULL pointer dereference indrivers/scsi/libsas/sas_discover.c because of mishandling of portdisconnection during discovery, related to a PHY down race condition, akaCID-f70267f379b5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19965` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-aws - 4.4.0-1062.66
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-azure - 4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.66').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.76~14.04.1').
